bolusSortOrderings: Anaphylaxis (see other page for other emergency drugs)
2nd Line Therapies (symptomatic, non lifesaving therapies):

wards.infusionChartHeader:
Midcentral High Dependancy
Common Infusions

Draw all infusions up (to volume specified) in 50ml syringes

bolusSortOrderings: Anaphylaxis (see other page for other emergency drugs)
2nd Line Therapies (symptomatic, non lifesaving therapies):

wards.bolusChartFooter:
These must be prescribed on the medication chart (and signed for) as soon as practicable

Chart is only valid for 1 week - Expires: [expires+7:ddd MMM d, yyyy]

infusionDrugs.note: load at 5-10 micrograms/kg/min for 4 hr then
NEVER in shock or compensated shock
see protocol for indications and dosing
Watch for hypotension. Keep serum Mg 1.5-2.5 mmol/L. May be repeated.
administer nearest number of whole vials (nearest 50ml)

bolusDrugs.drugName:
Adrenaline (1:10 000) IV/IO
(every 2nd CPR cycle ˜ every 4 mins)

Amiodarone (150 mg in 3 mL) IV/IO
(after 3rd shock)

Propofol (200 mg in 20 mL)
NEVER in shock or compensated shock

Fentanyl (100 micrograms in 2 mL)
intubation dose
Diazepam (10 mg in 2 mL) IV
Lorazepam (2 mg/mL) IV, slow push
Midazolam (15 mg in mL) IV

Ketamine Vial (200mg in 2 mL)
(NOT PREFILLED SYRINGE)

IM Midazolam (15mg in 3ml)
IM (no IV access)

Adrenaline (1:1000) Nebulised
dilute to a minimum of 4 mL

Ketamine Prefilled Syringe
(100mg in 10ml) NOT 2ml Vial
